text: Sándor Popovics (22 June 1939 — 1 July 2019) was a Hungarian-Dutch association football manager and a professional footballer in the position of forward. He was born in Keszthely, Hungary. As a footballer he played for Újpest Dózsa (1958–1960).Hongaarse baltovenaars - NRC He continued his football career in Germany at SpVgg Fürth (1960–1963) and later moved to Holland to play for Sparta (1963–64), and FC Zaanstreek (1964–1966). After retiring form playing, Popovics coached Dutch amateur clubs Quick (1970–1971), MVV '27 (1971–1972), RFC Rotterdam (1972–1974), Overmaas (1974-1976), Unitas (1976–1977), Xerxes (1977–1978) and Barendrecht (1978–1980). He also held the position of general manager at ADO Den HaagHONGAAR POPOVICS WORDT MANAGER BIJ DEN HAAG - Volkskrant and was named head scout at NAC in February 2002Sandor Popovics hoofd scouting - NAC He became a naturalized Dutch citizen in 1970.Sandor Popovics overleden - N.E.C. Popovics died on 1 July 2019 from Alzheimer's disease in Roosendaal, Netherlands, aged 80.Oud-trainer Popovics van De Graafschap en NEC overleden - Gelderlander ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Dutch football managers Category:Dutch footballers Category:Hungarian footballers Category:Naturalised citizens of the Netherlands
title: Sándor Popovics (footballer)
